NAME: Kanchan Y.
ABOUT: Experienced software engineer with experience in iOS app development working in the computer software industry for 4 years. Strong engineering professional with a BTech focused in Computer Science and Engineering from IIT, Hyderabad.

EXPERIENCE.Designation: Transportation Flow Modeling and Visualization for Disaster Management Applications

EXPERIENCE.Company Name: Institute for Development and Research in Banking Technology
EXPERIENCE.Designation: Summer Intern Project Enhancing Database security of Android Devices

PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Designed an 8-bit microprocessor with self-designed architecture which is intended to provide additional functionality and commands over 8085 using VHDL.

-  Developed Client – server data transfer using Socket Programming which simulates the MPTCP
protocol to simultaneously use multiple interfaces for a single data-stream, while still presenting a
standard TCP socket API to the application.
-  Lead to better resource usage and Resilience

Created a Tic-tac-toe game using C in which the computer never loses and also created day-to-day utilities such as long string calculator, calendar search application, word-search application using C/C++.

Implemented customized Linux Shell, process schedulers (lottery scheduler and custom MLFQ
scheduler) and memory manager for the Minix/Linux operating system.
Developed a shell similar to existing Linux/Minix3  shell with functionalities included pipelining, input output redirection, handling background processes, Cd Command, command history(Up Down Arrow Keys).

Designed a Library Management System Website rich in many social features such as rating,
recommendation, Personal Book-selves, Follow other people etc. using HTML5, CSS, Java Script
and PostgreSQL.

Developed a client-server based web application where user can create a graph by adding/deleting vertices and edges graphically on a canvas and then perform certain functions like finding shortest path (Dijikstra Algorithms) between any two selected vertices, save graph for future use using JSP, JavaScript, AJAX, HTML 5.0.
Developing a client-server based Android application (using web services) where user can convert portions of a color image to gray scale using kSOAP using Java and Android SDK(Eclipse IDE).

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Cool(Classroom object oriented programming language) Compiler in C++
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description: Implemented complete compiler for COOL, the Classroom Object Oriented Language in C++. It utilizes the Lex and Yacc for lexical analyzer, parser as well as Clang and LLVM for machine code generation.
Developed a TCP-based server-client multiuser chat application with some added functionalities such as group chat, selective chat, etc. as part of the Computer Networks course using Java

PROJECTS TAKEN.Title of Project: Copy Paste functionality over Network on Linux
PROJECTS TAKEN.Description:

using Alt+V key combination
